content.description: Water is pumped into an underground tank at a constant rate of 8 gallons per minute. Water leaks out of the tank at the rate of <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msqrt> <mrow> <mi>t</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mn>1</mn> </mrow> </msqrt> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@38A5@</annotation> </semantics> </math> gallons per minute, for <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mn>0</mn> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mn>120</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D42@</annotation> </semantics> </math> minutes. At time t = 0, the tank contains 30 gallons of water.
content.question: Write an expression for A(t), the total number of gallons of water in the tank at t.

frqParts.text: Write an expression for A(t), the total number of gallons of water in the tank at t.

topic.text: 7.7: Finding Particular Solutions Using Initial Conditions and Separation of Variables

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
